Description: Figure; bone; carving of a standing nude male; low relief; he leans on his left elbow, his right hand is held above his head and he is cross-legged.
Bibliographic references: Petrie at al 1915 / Heliopolis, Kafr Ammar and Shurafa (p. 44, pl. LII.11)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
Acquisition notes: Register says found at Shurafa, c.7 miles from the river opposite Mazghournels on the east bank, and about 7 miles south of Helouan.
